snippet: From baking in the hot sand to growing produce in the ash-rich hills, the island brims with ways to enjoy local food and wine.
abstract: Ancient cultures on Italian island of Ischia used heat generated by its volcanic activity, which simmers in both hot springs and under beach sands, for cooking, and handful of restaurants there are continuing tradition; recipe for chicken baked with potatoes, cherry tomatoes and herbs given.
lead_paragraph: From baking in the hot sand to growing produce in the ash-rich hills, the island brims with ways to enjoy local food and wine.

headline.main: In Ischia, Italy, Cooking Is Done in the Sand, Not the Stove
